pr_title: Add Camel AS2 Modules as Quarkus Extension #1471

timeline.bodyText: You shouldn't need to whitelist Camel configuration classes with Camel 3.5. The issues behind it should be fixed now.
timeline.author: jamesnetherton

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the suggestion. I'll look into option of fixing problem in its root in camel.
replies.author: JiriOndrusek

replies.bodyText: I should have also added that in Camel 3.5, you no longer have to register the various  EndpointConfiguration classes for reflection. So that part can be removed too.
replies.author: jamesnetherton
JiriOndrusek

replies.bodyText:
I didn't probably understood your previous comment correctly. To be sure:

I have to fix reason of failed reflection for camel classes
I can remove registration for reflection for camel, right?
replies.author: JiriOndrusek

replies.bodyText:
Urgh! Sorry for the confusion. I forgot I have not committed the crucial part that removes the policy extension yet.
Let me do on the camel-master branch ASAP and your changes should work ok afterwards. I'll ping you when it's done.
replies.author: jamesnetherton

replies.bodyText: @JiriOndrusek if you rebase on the latest work from camel-master, it should work for you now.
replies.author: jamesnetherton
